instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> VD0R Sensor Issue [solved]
threads.message:
i found that threat:

[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/165-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-macbook-pro-<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>-vd0r-sensor-issue-solved[/url]

i had the same problem.

but i feed the board with a labor unit (20A possible) and a macsafe cable

I found out if i feed the board with 18.5V then i get the same error about the VD0R Sensor

but if i feed the board with 16.5V then there is no error.

perhaps that could be helping someone as well. if possible please add still to the closed threat.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> VD0R Sensor Issue [solved]
threads.message:
This is to be expected as the right charger for 13" models supplies 16.5V.
In ASD EFI you can get a full diagnostic page showing the High and Low warning values and the current readout value. This would show that 18.5V is above the configured High limit

Glad you figured it out though, I was confused by this when I started for a moment as well
